description: A prominent Canadian technology investor joined the chorus of Canadian businesses criticizing Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s decision to raise the capital-gains tax, arguing it will cause capital flight from the country.
title: Maverix’s Ruffolo Warns Trudeau of Capital Flight After Tax Hike

description: Tensions are soaring, but Southeast Asian nations are struggling to push back on Beijing’s contested claims and tap the energy resources their growing economies need.
title: Xi’s Armada Is Winning the Battle for Energy in South China Sea

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Pentagon correspondent Tony Capaccio and White House senior reporter Jennifer Jacobs detail what’s holding up the new presidential helicopters. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: New US Presidential Chopper Is Too Hot to Handle

description: The White House is set to announce $1 billion in fresh military aid for Ukraine including 155mm artillery shells and air-defense munitions, two administration officials said, as the US looks to act quickly once a long-delayed supplemental funding request becomes law.
title: Biden Plans a $1 Billion Ukraine Weapons Package, Officials Say

description: Individual donors now are the largest source of funding for the United Nations relief agency that helps Palestinians, making up for some, but not all, of the $450 million lost when the US and other nations cut funding amid terrorism accusations by Israel after Hamas’s Oct. 7 attack.
title: Individual Donors Provide Most UNRWA Funding After US Halts Donations

description: Emmanuel Macron aims to slash layers of red tape that are holding back French businesses as his presidency faces growing economic headwinds.
title: Macron Targets French Bureaucracy as Economic Challenges Mount

description: The Senate advanced a $95 billion emergency aid package for Ukraine and other besieged US allies, putting the bill on track for final congressional approval.
title: Senate Advances Ukraine Aid, TikTok Divestment Bill in Key Vote

description: Gambian lawmakers have passed two new bills that could see former dictator Yahya Jammeh tried locally for crimes committed during his 22-year rule of the West African country.
title: Gambia’s New Law Could See Former Dictator Jammeh Tried Locally

description: Brazil’s tax collection lost steam according to official data published Tuesday, an ominous sign for government efforts to hit a budget target that’s closely watched by investors.
title: Brazil Tax Collection Loses Steam in Hurdle to Reaching Key Budget Target

description: The former head of the company that owned the National Enquirer told a New York jury about a 2015 meeting where he effectively became a conspirator in a plot to boost Donald Trump’s presidential campaign by squashing negative stories about his womanizing.
title: Tabloid CEO Says He Squashed Negative Stories on Trump Affairs

description: Russia is using a variety of measures — from AI-generated deep fakes to bags of cash — to undermine democracy in Moldova in a preview of what the West should expect, the tiny European nation’s foreign minister said Friday.
title: Russia Poised for Political Meddling in the West, Moldova Warns

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva cheered the Venezuelan opposition’s decision to unite behind a single candidate, saying that it will set the stage for a potentially legitimate election in the beleaguered nation led by Nicolas Maduro.
title: Lula Welcomes United Opposition in Venezuela Race Against Maduro

description: Donald Trump will likely be found in contempt of court for his social media posts that may violate a gag order as the New York judge overseeing his hush-money case characterized arguments by the former president’s lawyer as “silly.”
title: Trump May Lose Gag-Order Fight as Judge Calls Arguments ‘Silly’

description: Canada’s antitrust watchdog raised concerns about Bunge Ltd.’s proposed acquisition of Viterra Inc., saying it will have “substantial anti-competitive effects” on the country’s agricultural markets.
title: Bunge Deal for Viterra Raises Competition Red Flags, Canadian Agency Says

description: President Xi Jinping is expected to visit Belgrade around the 25th anniversary of the deadly US bombing of the city’s Chinese embassy, spotlighting an event that sparked anti-US protests at home and helped seed Beijing’s mistrust of NATO.
title: Xi Heads to Belgrade Around Anniversary of NATO Embassy Bombing

description: Siemens AG Chief Executive Officer Roland Busch added his voice to calls for Germany to loosen borrowing restrictions to help fund investments in the transformation of Europe’s biggest economy.
title: Siemens CEO Backs Calls to Ease German Debt Rules for Investment

description: European Union watchdogs raided the premises of an unidentified security equipment firm in another test of a new law aimed at preventing foreign state-funded companies from abusing their financial muscle to fend off EU rivals.
title: EU Raids Security Equipment Firm Under Foreign Subsidy Law

description: The United Nations suspended some of its humanitarian relief in South Sudan after the government blocked fuel imports needed to keep operations going.
title: UN Scales Back South Sudan Aid as Government Blocks Fuel Imports

description: Germany’s central bank chief reiterated his concern about the rise of extremist parties, saying he’s worried about the upcoming European Parliament elections.
title: Bundesbank Chief Worried About Euroskeptic Gains at EU Elections

description: Rishi Sunak pledged to increase defense spending to 2.5% of GDP by end of the decade, as the prime minister seeks to ease concerns at home and abroad about the level of investment in the British armed forces.
title: Sunak Commits UK to Spending 2.5% of GDP on Military by 2030

description: The UK will enforce “light-touch” post-Brexit checks on food and plant products beginning later this month to avoid disrupting businesses trading with European Union nations, a government minister said.
title: Post-Brexit Food Checks Will Be ‘Light-Touch,’ UK Minister Says

description: Australia’s domestic intelligence chief warned that artificial intelligence is likely to dramatically improve the capabilities of the nation’s enemies — resulting in increased espionage, disinformation and radicalization.
title: Australia’s Spy Chief Warns AI Set to Accelerate Radicalization

description: The European Union is assessing potential sanctions against more than a dozen companies that have continued to buy restricted goods from the bloc and supply them to Russia, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU Weighs Sanctions on Firms Shipping Weapons Tech to Russia

description: Russia threatened to step up strikes on Ukraine in response to the US vote to provide $61 billion in new military aid to the government in Kyiv.
title: Russia Threatens to Intensify Strikes on Ukraine Over US Aid

description: Russia’s Security Council Secretary Nikolai Patrushev and China’s security chief Chen Wenqing discussed strengthening ties between the special services and law enforcement agencies of their two countries at talks on Tuesday.
title: Russia Hosts China, Iran Security Chiefs to Discuss Cooperation

description: One of the most prominent regional leaders of the far-right Alternative for Germany party, on trial for using a Nazi slogan, said in court on Tuesday he did nothing wrong and never violated any laws.
title: German Far-Right AfD Leader Denies He Knew About Nazi Slogan

description: Flooding and drone strikes on refineries likely help to keep flows elevated
title: Russia's Crude Exports Cling to Gains With Refineries Hobbled

description: The new presidential helicopter has been demoted to backup duty because Lockheed Martin Corp. still can’t figure out how to keep it from scorching the White House’s South Lawn.
title: Biden’s New Chopper Is Demoted After Scorching White House Lawn

description: Police in Dresden detained a German national suspected of carrying out acts of espionage for China, taking the tally of alleged Chinese spies arrested in Europe in recent days to six.
title: Espionage Arrests Hint at Dark Side of China-Europe Competition

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Opposition May Give a Strong Fight to Modi’s BJP in Coaching Capital Kota: India Votes

description: The South Asia bureau chief for Australia’s ABC News left India after she said she faced problems extending her visa following a critical report about Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government.
title: Australia Reporter Leaves India, Citing Visa Troubles, Video Ban

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China Shakes Up Military to Better Compete With the West

description: Thailand will start the process to elect new senators next month, in an exercise that will make the upper house more representative than the outgoing lawmakers who were appointed by the military.
title: Thailand Plans for First Post-Coup Senate Election, Referendum

description: Thailand’s cabinet approved a plan to allow Russian tourists who enter the country without a visa to stay for a maximum of two months as the Southeast Asian country bets on tourism to support an economic recovery.
title: Thailand Extends Longer Visa-Free Stay for Russians Until July to Boost Tourism

description: President Luis Arce is proud of taming inflation. But a long-brewing financial crisis puts that signature achievement at risk, potentially opening the way for his mentor-turned-rival, Evo Morales.
title: Bolivia’s Boom Has Turned to Bust, Fueling an Unlikely Presidential Comeback Bid

description: President Joe Biden is putting the spotlight on one of the country’s most restrictive abortion laws, seizing on the issue while on Donald Trump’s own Florida turf and as his rival is distracted by a criminal trial.
title: Biden Takes Abortion Fight to Sidelined Trump’s Florida Turf

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that banks in the European Union should be able to move their capital freely throughout the bloc, echoing a demand voiced by many executives in the sector.
title: Scholz Says EU Banks Need Ability to Move Capital Across Bloc

description: Police in Dresden have detained a German national suspected of carrying out acts of espionage for China. The man, according to a report by ARD, is an employee of Maximilian Krah, the far-right AfD’s lead candidate in the European Parliament elections.
title: Germany Arrests Aide to Far-Right Party for Spying for China

description: China is rapidly becoming more aggressive in its rhetoric and actions across Asia, the outgoing head of the US Indo-Pacific Command said, as Beijing turned up the heat on Washington just before Secretary of State Tony Blinken heads to the country for a high-stakes visit.
title: US Commander Warns China Is Fast Becoming More Aggressive in Region

description: Switzerland has blocked 13 billion francs ($14.2 billion) in Russian assets held in the country, including more than 7 billion francs in reserves and assets of Russia’s central bank.
title: Switzerland Blocks More Than $14 Billion of Russian Assets

description: China needs to take a stand over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and rein in its enormous trade surplus with the European Union if it is committed to improving relations, the bloc’s top diplomat in Asia said.
title: China’s Putin Ties Risk Relations With EU, Top Diplomat Says

description: Ukrainian anti-graft agencies say they have discovered that Agriculture Minister Mykola Solskyi was involved in a scheme to illegally appropriate agriculture land in the northern Sumy region.
title: Ukraine Anti-graft Office Suspects Agriculture Minister of Fraud

description: UK government borrowing overshot official forecasts in the last fiscal year, highlighting the constraints on Chancellor Jeremy Hunt as he eyes pre-election tax cuts.
title: UK Budget Deficit Overshoots in Setback for Hunt’s Tax Cut Plans

description: US companies are wary about investing in China because of policy unpredictability, according to a business group, as Beijing struggles to attract foreign funds to boost its economy.
title: US Firms Still Cautious About Investing in China, AmCham Says

description: South Africa’s former President Jacob Zuma’s newly formed party vowed to nationalize land and banks, withdraw from the International Criminal Court and expand the social security net in its campaign manifesto released before May 29 elections.
title: Zuma’s Party Wants to Nationalize Land, Mines in South Africa

description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Taro Aso is set to meet former President Donald Trump on Tuesday night in the US, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Japan’s Former Premier Aso to Meet Trump as US Election Looms

description: Two helicopters crashed during a Malaysian navy parade rehearsal Tuesday, killing all 10 military personnel on board.
title: Two Malaysia Navy Helicopters Crash, Killing 10 Personnel

description: Hong Kong’s leader said the finance hub won’t pass a fake news law so long as media outlets exercise self-discipline, indicating the government has paused plans floated three years ago.
title: Hong Kong Will Shelve Fake News Law If Media Is ‘Professional’

description: China launched its harshest attack to date on US complaints about industrial overcapacity, signaling that Secretary of State Antony Blinken may be in for some difficult conversations during his visit this week.
title: China Condemns US’s Overcapacity Claim Just Before Blinken Visit

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s government is pushing the US to deliver at least one more Patriot anti-missile system to Ukraine to help close the air-defense gap as Russia escalates a barrage of attacks, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany Urges US to Send Ukraine Another Patriot Missile System

description: Russia’s “complete embrace” of North Korea could increase Kim Jong Un’s appetite for risk when it comes to threatening South Korea and exporting weapons abroad, as well as helping Pyongyang ignore Washington’s call to return to nuclear talks, a senior Biden administration official said.
title: Russia’s North Korea Embrace Could Embolden Kim Jong Un, US Says

description: President Javier Milei announced Argentina’s first quarterly fiscal surplus since 2008 during a televised speech, promising his commitment to eliminating deficits wouldn’t waver throughout his term.
title: Milei Trumpets Quarterly Budget Surplus in Argentina TV Address

description: Elon Musk’s social network X has been hit with an interim injunction by an Australian court to remove footage of a stabbing attack, prompting a furious response from the owner who accused the government of censorship.
title: Musk Loses Australia Court Hearing on Sydney Knife Attack Posts
